title: Can anybody help with any of the fonts used in these logos. Much appreciated.
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458im_/http:/typophile.com/files/boston_6730.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [D-BOX\_Logo.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458/http:/typophile.com/files/D-BOX_Logo_0.png) | 10.67 KB |
| [Future Automation Logo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458/http:/typophile.com/files/Future%20Automation%20Logo_0.jpg) | 84.02 KB |
| [New-Velodyne-logo\_color1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458/http:/typophile.com/files/New-Velodyne-logo_color1_0.jpg) | 446.47 KB |
author: Ninimpie

comments.content:
Boston acoustics  
- Boston: my intuition says "custom work based on [Eurostile](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458/http:/myfonts.us/td-K7AVcb)"  
- acoustics: (also) [Eurostile](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/eurostile)

D-BOX Motion Code  
- D-BOX: probably lazy after the previous suggestions but looks like a custom job and, why not, from Eurostile. [Saturn](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dsgnhaus/saturn) is another "eurostile-like" that could work too (and for "Boston (accosutics)" too).  
- MOTION CODE: possibly [Avant-Garde Condensed](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/avant+garde)

Future Automation Moving Audio Visual  
- future automation: [very first version](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458/http:/www.ffonts.net/Forgotten-Futurist.font?text=future%20automation) of [Forgotten Futurist](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/forgotten-futurist) looks like to match to me  
- moving audio visual solutions: [Helvetica Neue Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/helvetica+neue)

Velodyne  
 [Avant-Garde Demi](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/avant-garde-gothic/), Pro version to get alternates / [e](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/avant-garde-gothic/pro-demibold/glyphs.html#glyphs/545652/487) and / [y](http://web.archive.org/web/20130621145458/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/avant-garde-gothic/pro-demibold/glyphs.html#glyphs/545652/523)
